data.title: ProgressBar should have set_text function
data.body: We should be able to disable the default percentage text shown on a ProgressBar, and optionally set it to whatever value we want by calling set_text(string).

data.title: Add Matrix32/Vector2Array support for marshal library
data.body: Add Matrix32/Vector2Array support for marshal libraray.

data.title: tilemap group assignment - enhancement
data.body:
I have created a tilemap with collision shapes. This works so far.
Only thing that doesn't work is checking single tiles for groups.
I have tiles that are walls and I have added a wall group for them.

Raycast cannot detect them as objects which can be checked for groups.
It would be nice if tilemaps would store each tile separate.

data.title: editor window title improvements
data.body:
Shows the project name in the window title (good to differentiate multiple instances of Godot with different projects loaded).

Clears the previous scene name from the window title when creating a new scene.

data.title: the  #240 about signal of "release" not resolved!
data.body: the signal "released" can connect on Connections dialog.but can not got the "release" event on my moblie. I think the version of 2014.04.06 just resolved the config file of "released",but the real function can not work too...

data.title: Wrong typedef in file int_types.h?
data.body:
I was looking to the code and I notice that in the header file int_types.h I think that the line: typedef unsigned long long int64_t;
must be: typedef unsigned long long uint64_t;

data.title: Add export templates download link to github wiki
data.body:
Currently it's only found here: http://www.godotengine.org/wiki/doku.php
It would be great to have all the info/needed tools in one place.

data.title: set_text can not accept str(number)
data.body:
this can not work:
get_node("label").set_text(str(10))

this can work:
get_node("label").set_text("10")

version date: 2014.04.06

data.title: Compile Godot tools for Android
data.body: Can the entire program be compiled into a version for Android, so that game development can be entirely completed on the go?

data.title: Godot editor infinite loop when setting tilemap scale to (0,0)
data.body:
1. Add TileMap.
2. In Inspector set scale to x = 0, y = 0.
   Then the program hangs, and consumption of RAM is more than 500 MB.

data.title: Remote Node Enhancement
data.body:
At the moment the Remote Node can control a different node. But always controls all three transformations(Rotation,Position and Scale).
It would be nice if there were 3 checkboxes which can be set. So this way the remote node only controls the checked transformations. Sometimes I want to keep the scale different from the remote node. This way it will give some extra flexibility.

data.title: High DPI Artwork for Default Theme
data.body:
Art only, still trying to figure out how to implement it. In the mean time someone else is welcome to try.

I'd also be interested in any opinions on the best way to implement it.

data.title: Hand tool in 2d editor
data.body:
I think it will be awesome if in 2d editor appears "hand tool" which acts same as in photoshop.
It is not handy to use scroll every time when you zoom in/out.

What do you think?

data.title: Problem trying to install Mac OS X export template under Mac OS X 10.9
data.body: I tried to export a Mac OS app under Mac OS X 10.9 using the zip found on download page, but it just hangs forever. Is there a "how-to" to make my own export template, or is there another Mac OS export template anywhere?

data.title: Incorrect z-ordering visibles 3D objects in 3D scene rendering.
data.body:
For visibles 3D-objects Z-ordering is done randomly when rendering 3D-scenes.
Try running the same scene several times. It will be seen.
But it is also visible in the viewport (perspective mode).

Perhaps this is a bug.

3D Scene Top View (Orthogonal):
![2014-04-07 14 39 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7200664/2630033/81a01264-be41-11e3-861d-53cadebf4b78.png)

3D Scene Front View, Render (Perspective):
![2014-04-07 14 40 20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7200664/2630045/b6ab3772-be41-11e3-987a-0e7220c3a9f9.png)

data.title: Primitives node
data.body:
Currently to draw primitives you have to do it in code within the _draw() function.
It would be nice if we could just add a "Primitive2D" node to the scene and select the shape we want to draw from properties.

data.title: Collision Masks?
data.body:
It would be great if there was in godot a system to make collision masks, so that we could easily create groups of objects that could collide only with some other group of objects.

You can see an example of using bitmask for collisions in this wiki: http://www.bulletphysics.org/mediawiki-1.5.8/index.php?title=Collision_Filtering

data.title: New add dynamic ttf loading support
data.body:
Add dynamic load ttf features to godot engine.
this feature makes:
1. less package size(not need import one or more large fnt files), only include a ttf and some small dynamic fnt files)
2.load faster(dynamic create font atlas in runtime when label/edit draw)

but it need more memory for freetype library, whole ttf files will loaded in memory, and cost more cpu times to gen font atlas(once, generated atlas will cached in memory)

Usage:
Import -> Font, Click 'Dynamic/enabled' options and select a ttf file(must in your project folder), that's all.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6880378/2625547/800cf02e-bd9d-11e3-8e3f-131fe3f66e75.png)

data.title: Wiki documentation fixes
data.body:
I read through the entire wiki (except the API docs) today and figured that while I was at it I'd correct the various spelling and grammar errors and make a few minor changes to improve readability. A patch (against e8f6e2e) containing my fixes can be found at:

https://gist.github.com/brettle/10007085

You can download the raw patch at:

https://gist.githubusercontent.com/brettle/10007085/raw/6a4f14d57d34af504a2e0bc4e037a91974c03000/godot.wiki-readability.patch

data.title: Fixed Android crash by adding safety to the hideKeyboard() -function.
data.body: I tested this on Xperia Mini Pro with Android 4.0.4, which crashed always nicely. In the original code, the activity.getCurrentFocus() always returned null on my project (PopupDialog with LineEdit and/or TextEdit)

data.title: Can't set Master Player in AnimationTreePlayer
data.body:
Built from source from latest commit (9f33134c93ecbadda70e8eefc50563e29b2eb7f2),
The "Master Player" field stays empty after an AnimationPlayer is choosen. The command line output complains that the node does not exist, even if the path is correct. It works in the beta1 release. I'm still too new to godot to investigate myself, does anyone confirm the bug?

data.title: Typo on website: " iOS deployment targety will be available the coming weeks."
data.body: "targety" should be "target".

data.title: Tilemap and negative tile positions...
data.body:
Let's suppose you created a tilemap and you begin to draw tiles in negative tile positions... Ok, now save and reload the scene... What happened? The purple rectangles in the scrollbars become super-small, as the tile map area were VERY BIG... 

And now, if you draw in negative tile positions, the previous tile will not change nor will be deleted.

I think negative positions for tiles mess something within the scene file, because before saving the scene it was all right.

data.title: set_linear_velocity issue?
data.body:
Ok,
I have to admit that I am not exactly sure if this is a bug, or an issue on my side.

I am moving my character something like this:

```
set_linear_velocity(Vector2(speed, get_linear_velocity().y))
```

So in the fixed_process function runs everything es expected. I can move my character and the y velocity is always set to the on it gets from the gravity. But running this function in the _process function my character falls with at very low speed down. The get_linear_velocity().y seems to be messed up?

Is this an issue on my side? Or maybe a bug in godot?

data.title: Enable touch event emulation on desktop
data.body:
- Emulate SCREEN_TOUCH and SCREEN_DRAG event on desktop (win/mac/linux) when emulate_touchscreen options is on
- Resolve issue #249, now touch only control's behavior (eg. TouchScreenButton) could be emulated on desktop

data.title: emulate_touchscreen functionality should be more broad
data.body: The emulate_touchscreen option currently is used for lists and scroll containers mostly, but should be expanded to work for other types of controls too.

data.title: Tilemap image fails
data.body:
I followed the Platformer example and in the scene "tile_edit.scn" all the object origins is in point 0,0.
When I use the node type TileMap on main scene and load the made tileset, this issue appears. When I draw a tile in a point his image (sprite) is rendered forward! Some distance like 192x192 pixels distant. (see image).
But their collision bounds and mouse coordinates are normal.
This occurs in downladed version on site, and with compiled newest version of Github.
![captura de tela de 2014-04-02 22-46-12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/85936/2602724/23a110c0-bb24-11e3-831b-0acf845c3203.jpg)
